content.description: This route climbs up broken ledges with awesome solid conglomerate rock.
content.location: SW corner of Goose Island, gray open dihedral

climbs.name: Snake and Eggs
climbs.fa: Dakota Walz, Jeremy Collins, and Blake Bennett

content.description: Start right of the little cave on a spine feature. Climb the spine to a ledge and climb straight up the technical face and through a large smooth shoot feature.
content.location: North side of Goose Island, starts right of little cave.

content.description: Righteous climbing up an arête with a no hands rest before the first crux. Pull sequential moves high up at the second crux to reach the anchor.
content.location: North side of Goose Island, farthest route to the left.

climbs.name: Pirates of the Carabiner
climbs.fa: Jer Collins, Zion Collins, Bryan Schillig, Billy Claycomb

content.description: Start at the SW corner of Goose Island. Traverse out left to a single bolt belay, then angle up the face and top out.
White arête on the southwest corner of Goose Island
content.protection: Bolts, shares lower offs with Climbing for Two

content.description: One of the two must do traverses over the water. Climb sustained 5.8 starting on the south side. Work your way over the water to a crux at the overhang just before reaching the shore again. The overhang is about 5.9 if you go high or 5.10 if you climb low at the water.

climbs.name: Earth Apple
climbs.fa: Jer Collins, Dakota Walz, and Billy Claycomb

content.description: Short route with soft rock on an arête.

Grey corner to the left. 

  First done pregnant.
content.protection: Small rack of cams, shares lower offs with Firestar

climbs.name: Captain Bird Beard
climbs.fa: Jeremy Collins, Dakota Walz, Blake Bennett

content.description: Start near the water on a small boulder. When flooded start as of Snake & Eggs and traverse in. Climb the beautiful far right arête nearly right over the water.
content.location: North side of Goose Island, farthest to the right near the water.

content.description: Climb up above the left side of the little cave, into a technical vertical face and straight up to the anchors.
content.location: This line goes straight up the center of the North side wall. Starts left of the little cave

content.description:
Goose Island has a tall north wall with a small cave. This feature is stacked with the best moderate routes of Raven Rocks, hides the coveted 5.6 bolted sport lines, and the harder of the two water traverses.  

  Make sure to climb Snake 'n' Eggs and Raven Lunatic! 

  Top-rope access is as easy as a scramble to the summit and a quick battle with the geese!
